items.title: Tensions Over Park Behavior as Homelessness Rises in New York City
items.abstract: Encampments in public spaces are prompting concern in neighboring communities about conduct such as public urination and sleeping on benches.

items.title: Met Opera Fires Stage Director, Citing ‘Inappropriate Behavior’
items.abstract: John Copley was dismissed from the Met’s revival of Rossini’s “Semiramide” after a complaint about his behavior toward a chorister.

items.title: Review: Pacific Northwest Ballet Plays With Limits and Dystopia at City Center
items.abstract: Pacific Northwest Ballet delivered two New York premieres on Friday, David Dawson’s “A Million Kisses to My Skin” and Crystal Pite’s “Emergence.”

items.title: City Council Passes Bills on Police Behavior Amid Outcry on Both Sides
items.abstract: The so-called Right to Know Act was adopted along with 36 other bills during Melissa Mark-Viverito’s final Council vote as speaker.

items.title: High Design: The Revolution Taking Over Cannabis Dispensaries
items.abstract: As cannabis legalization has become more widespread, retailers are getting increasingly serious about the design and branding of their shops.
